CricketMatch.MatchReport:
Some fine individual performances earned Twyford a winning draw, and some well deserved points to kick-start their season. After losing the toss and being out into bat by the Hawley side, who beat Holyport last week, Connor (31) and Helmore (5) put on 25 for the first wicket. After Helmore was caught pushing the ball into the covers, Hobson arrived and was quickly sent back having nicked the ball to the wicket keeper off the surprising pace of Khaki. This brought Jez Henry (65) to the wicket who punished the poor bowling with some superb shots and put on 62 with Connor and 71 with Jackson (47). Jackson's innings in particular punished a number of dropped catches with some brutal shots, including two sixes.

With 5 overs left and with the score on 167 it looked as though Twyford would be able to post a score around the 200 mark and put some serious pressure on the Hawley side. Much like the England side though things didn't go to plan. Three quick wickets for Sinclair saw Jackson, Theron (0) and Fort (0)sent back to the pavilion while the opener Khaki returned to remove Henry and a suicidal run saw Greg Neall a few yards short. Only 19 runs were scored and 5 wickets were lost in those crucial final overs which left the Twyford side wondering if 186 would be enough.

Missing a couple of bowlers Twyford started the second innings looking to keep things tight and make runs hard to come by. The Bowling of Potier was very accurate and he rattled off 15 overs for only 29 runs. At the other end the fast, attacking bowling of Jackson was a revelation and he ripped through the top order with only Hargreaves (30) showing any resistance. With the score 53 for 4 off 22 overs, Hobson replaced Jackson in a effort to open the game up and gained a breakthrough in his 3rd over when he trapped Johnston leg before.

The Hawley middle order played very well and, with time at the crease, built some useful partnerships with Gentle (40) and Khaki (28*). Picking up their runs at a leisurely pace they were always falling behind the run rate and needed 98 from the final 15. With Jackson being re-introduced it looked a tall order and the field became more attacking as each over passed. Jackson was able to pick up his fifth wicket and finished on 5-45. Hobson flighted the ball higher and higher towards the end and prised a couple of chances that went begging and also tempted Gentle into playing a rash shot which he missed and was bowled. Hawley concentrated on getting an extra batting point, which they acheived in the final over and settled for the draw.

Twyford take heart from this display with some excellent fielding from all involved, most notably Greg Neall who's fielding at point was an example to everyone else.
